dtliExcerpt: By design, clearly. You don’t need to be a Black woman with braids to enjoy this play. Heck, it might teach you something about the intricacies of a craft you only have observed from afar. But this play is also trying to reach a Black popular audience, long ignored by Broadway.

showScoreExcerpt: “ ‘Jaja’s’ is a comedy about life as it is lived in this place, about community, aspiration and entrepreneurship. Mostly, though, it’s a show about immigrants getting the job done, and having fun doing it, one braid at a time.”
